notes.text: This CSAF advisory was extracted from unstructured data and may contain inaccuracies. If you notice any errors, please reach out to the designated contact at CISA CSAF: central@cisa.dhs.gov

notes.text: Successful exploitation of these vulnerabilities could allow an attacker to access cookies and take over the user's session.
notes.title: Risk evaluation

notes.text: CISA recommends users take defensive measures to minimize the risk of exploitation of this vulnerability these vulnerabilities. Specifically, users should:
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: CISA also provides a section for control systems security recommended practices on the ICS webpage at cisa.gov/ics. Several CISA products detailing cyber defense best practices are available for reading and download, including Improving Industrial Control Systems Cybersecurity with Defense-in-Depth Strategies.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: Additional mitigation guidance and recommended practices are publicly available on the ICS webpage at cisa.gov/ics in the technical information paper, ICS-TIP-12-146-01B--Targeted Cyber Intrusion Detection and Mitigation Strategies.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: No known public exploits specifically target these vulnerabilities. These vulnerabilities have a high attack complexity.Â
notes.title: Exploitability

product.name: -System Configuration Tool: System Configuration Tool (SCT) version 14: Versions prior to 14.2.3
-System Configuration Tool: System Configuration Tool (SCT) version 15: Versions prior to 15.0.3

notes.text: System Configuration Tool (SCT) versions 14 and 15 are vulnerable during a cross-site scripting attack. This could allow an attacker to access cookies and take control of an affected system.-CVE-2022-21939 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 7.5 has been calculated; the CVSS vector string is (AV:N/AC:H/PR:N/UI:R/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: Johnson Controls recommends users take the following actions to mitigate the vulnerabilities.
Contact your local Johnson Controls office or Authorized Building Control Specialists (ABCS)
For more detailed mitigation instructions, please see Johnson Controls Product Security Advisory JCI-PSA-2022-07 v1

cwe.name: Sensitive Cookie in HTTPS Session Without 'Secure' Attribute

notes.text: System Configuration Tool (SCT) versions 14 and 15 are vulnerable during a cross-site scripting attack.
